Package com.sdtech.stringextractor

Class StringExtractor

java.lang.Object
com.sdtech.stringextractor.StringExtractor
public abstract class StringExtractor extends Object
StringExtractor is used to extracts raw strings from a java and xml files to a optional xml file and link them.

StringExtract extracts any non blank strings from java file. and only extracts the strings from supported xml attributes below:

  • android:text
  • android:title
  • android:summary
  • android:label
  • android:hint
  • android:description
Note: if one of the above attributes contains the text which starts with '@' or '?' will be ignore even if it is not '@string/*' or '?attr/*'.

Created by sdtech @ 11:54 AM 13 Jan 2025. Github link https://github.com/csdtech

    • setFileToRead

      public void setFileToRead(File fileToRead)
      Set the file to read and extracts strings from.

      The file must be non-null, valid java or xml and exists.

      Parameters:
      fileToRead - The java or xml file to read and extracts strings from.

    • getFileToRead

      public File getFileToRead()
      Returns:
      The given file to read strings from.

    • setXmlFile

      public void setXmlFile(File xmlFile)
      Set the file to write the generated xml..

      This is usually on values folder of project. e.g PROJECT_ROOT/res/values/x_strings.xml

      Parameters:
      xmlFile - The file to write the generated xml.

    • getXmlFile

      public File getXmlFile()
      Returns:
      The given file to write the generated xml.

    • setExtractedString

      public void setExtractedString(boolean extractedString)
      Enable or disable the use of ExtractedString class to get the strings.

      This should only be set on java file, otherwise will not be used.

      Parameters:
      extractedString - indicates whether to use ExtractedString class or not.

    • isExtractedString

      public boolean isExtractedString()
      Returns:
      Returns whether ExtractedString enabled or not.

      Set prefix string to use when generating extracted string names in xml file.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setModeRecursive

      public void setModeRecursive(boolean modeRecursive)
      Flag to make the use of getExtractCount() when generating the extracted string names in xml file.

      Note: This wont make the recursive search and extraction of the strings unless implemented.

      Parameters:
      modeRecursive - flag to let use the extractCount or not.

    • isModeRecursive

      public boolean isModeRecursive()
      Returns:
      Returns true if the given path as input is a directory and recursive flag is applied, false otherwise.

    • setExtractCount

      public void setExtractCount(int extractCount)
      Set the count to start from and increases instead of starting from 0. This is important only when extracting multiple files at same time.
      Parameters:
      extractCount - The number to start from.

    • getExtractCount

      public int getExtractCount()
      Returns:
      Returns The number to begin the count from if set or zero.

    • startExtraction

      public abstract void startExtraction() throws ExtractionException
      Start the extraction using provided file(s) and option(s).
      Throws:
      ExtractionException - when an Exception occur while extracting strings.

    • extractString

      public static void extractString(File fileToRead, File xmlFile, boolean extractedString, String prefix, String suffix, boolean backupFile, boolean modeRecursive, int extractCount) throws ExtractionException
      Extracts the strings from single xml or java file, save to xml file and link them.
      Parameters:
      fileToRead - the valid xml or java file to read and extract strings from.
      xmlFile - the file to write the extracted strings.
      extractedString - if true and fileToRead is java file the class ExtractedString will be used to get the strings.

      See the ExtractedString for more info.

      prefix - the String to use as prefix for generating strings name in xml
      suffix - the String to use as suffix for generating strings name in xml
      backupFile - indicates wether to backup the file before writing the extracted strings to file.
      modeRecursive - this make the extractCount to be used when generating names instead of starting from zero when set to true.
      extractCount - the count to start from, this will be ignore if modeRecursive is false.
      Throws:
      ExtractionException - when an exception occured during extracting strings from file.
